metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9893 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Thunderbird 45.5. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortthat some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 50.1, Firefox ESR < 45.6, and Thunderbird <45.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
